snippet: People from three ethnic groups engaged in a civil war have made homes on a United Nations peacekeeping base.
abstract: United Nations peacekeeping force base in Malakal, South Sudan, now serves as refugee camp for members of at least three of ethnic groups involved in civil war in the country; base was never meant to house refugees, but has now become permanent encampment, and escalation in fighting has made challenging situation with dwindling resources even worse.
lead_paragraph: People from three ethnic groups engaged in a civil war have made homes on a United Nations peacekeeping base.

headline.main: South Sudan Enemies Find Uneasy Refuge Together at a U.N. Base
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Adversaries Find Uneasy Refuge at a Peacekeeping Base

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commission for Refugees
